meanings.definition: Capable of being exchanged or interchanged
meanings.sent1: The toy cars were commutable, so the children could trade them easily.
meanings.sent2: In the game, players have commutable tokens that they can swap with each other.
meanings.sent3: The commutable tickets allowed passengers to switch seats on the train for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her commutable skills in negotiation made her a valuable team member.
meanings.sent5: The commutable nature of the currency made transactions smooth and efficient.

meanings.definition: Able to be converted or transformed
meanings.sent1: The old warehouse was commutable into a cozy cafe with some renovations.
meanings.sent2: The raw material was commutable into a beautiful piece of art by the skilled artist.
meanings.sent3: She had a commutable talent for turning simple ingredients into gourmet meals.
meanings.sent4: His commutable ideas sparked innovation in the company.
meanings.sent5: The commutable energy from the sun can be harnessed for electricity.

meanings.sent1: The commutable weather meant we had to be prepared for sudden changes.
meanings.sent2: The commutable schedule allowed for adjustments based on new information.
meanings.sent3: His commutable mood swings kept his friends on their toes.
meanings.sent4: The commutable nature of fashion trends keeps designers on their toes.
meanings.sent5: The commutable storyline in the movie kept the audience engaged.
